title: Cazz Photography
excerpt: A simple portfolio showcasing the different aspects of Cazz as a photographer.

sections.title: The Brief
sections.content: Cazz is an amateur photographer and needed something to showcase her new found love of taking pictures and making the most of every scene.

sections.title: The Result
sections.content: I create a simple design that wouldn't get in the way of showcasing her photos. A photography site should be about the pictures, so I made sure her new website focused on that by focusing on her work first and foremost.

title: Harlist
excerpt: A to do app with a focus on simplicity. Only the features you need to get things done.

sections.title: The Brief
sections.content: To do list apps are everywhere, but my biggest issue with them all is how bloated they all are. Social login, user tracking, email notifications. The list goes on. I wanted something really simple to get the job done, so I built it.

sections.title: The Result
sections.content:
A to do app should let you one thing easily, create to dos. That's with Harlist it's the only thing you can do.

Aside from updating your account details, all you can do is create tasks or lists. That's it.

title: Inspirational Pixels
excerpt: Web design blog focused on helping beginners with tutorials, videos, code snippets and freebies.

sections.title: The Brief
sections.content:
I've been running Inspirational Pixels since 2013, so around five years. In that time the site has built up quite a large archive of varying content.

The real aim of the redesign was to make the content easily accessible, but have a focus on showing the difference between pieces of content.

The main staples of content on the site are tutorials, articles, freebies and snippets, so there needed to be a way of easily identifying what each piece was without having to click into it.

sections.title: The Result
sections.content:
Everything is now easily identifiable by having a unique card design for each post preview. The cards are dynamic change depending on what type of content they are.

Posts that are either tutorials or articles are tagged with a matching icon. Freebies show the file size at the bottom of the card and snippets show the code language the snippet is written in.

I also had the opportunity to rework the placement of the ads on the site. Before it was annoying to see ads plastered in the sidebar. Now in the redesign, the sidebar is gone and ads flow better in the overall design, yet are still obvious that they are advertisements.
